str2: A primary particle; but, and, etc.
A day, the period from sunrise to sunset.

parse: Verb - Aorist Participle Middle - Genitive Feminine Singular
str2: A prolongation and middle voice form of a primary verb; to cause to be, i.e. to become, used with great latitude.
The, the definite article. Including the feminine he, and the neuter to in all their inflections; the definite article; the.
From the base of stratia and ago or hegeomai; a general, i.e. a governor, the chief of the temple-wardens.

parse: Verb - Aorist Indicative Active - 3rd Person Plural
str2: From apo and stello; set apart, i.e. to send out literally or figuratively.
The, the definite article. Including the feminine he, and the neuter to in all their inflections; the definite article; the.
A holder of the rods, a lictor, Roman officer, judge. From rhabdos and echo; a rod- holder, i.e. A Roman lictor.

parse: Verb - Present Participle Active - Nominative Masculine Plural
str2: (a) I say, speak; I mean, mention, tell, (b) I call, name, especially in the pass., (c) I tell, command.

parse: Verb - Aorist Imperative Active - 2nd Person Singular
str2: From apo and luo; to free fully, i.e. relieve, release, dismiss, or let die, pardon or divorce.
That, that one there, yonder. From ekei; that one (neuter) thing); often intensified by the article prefixed.
A man, one of the human race. From aner and ops; man-faced, i.e. A human being.
